story.kicker_image_caption: Narendra Modi presenting Start UP India
story.storykicker: Raising question over the registration process of Startup India, mobile app developer Himanshu said, "The registration process should be more simplified".
story.storybody:
Himanshu Kumar, a budding entrepreneur, who has developed a mobile app "Hello Tax" is not much upbeat about government's Startup India scheme. The idea of launching the app came from the problems salaried people faced while filing IT returns. He launched the app and it received good response as it facilitates filing the return in three simple steps taking a maximum of five minutes. But, when he visited the Startup portal, launched by the Modi government, to register his startup, he was disappointed. Raising question over the registration process of Startup, Himanshu said, "The registration process should be more simplified.

They ask for incubator. Now, where would a new entrepreneur get an incubator? Suppose a person who does not have a degree from an IIT, IIM or for that matter from any prestigious institute, where would he go to find an incubator. Finding an incubator is one of the important conditions for registration on the portal."

Explaining further, he said that the government Startup portal is not asking much about the business idea. "They should ask about business details of the Startup. Or there should be a third agency, might be a body of experts from IIT or IIM to verify the idea. But, they have left it completely on incubator," he rued.

Himanshu claimed that with the app, tax payers having limited or no knowledge of the tedious tax filing process can file the IT return in a few minutes. Showing details of communication with government officials, he said that he approached the IT department for a licence to make things simpler, but, nothing happened. "I have contacted many senior officials giving representation and benefits of the app.

But, nothing has come out. I kept visiting offices for months, but, they preferred to ignore," he said adding that he is the least disheartened as his venture has received good response in past few months from common people. He claimed that a licence from the IT department will make the tax filing quicker and people would be able to file the tax with one or two clicks or after just entering the PAN details.

 Also Read:Modi's Start Up India scheme receives positive response from entrepreneurs
